Reviews.Title: “Good location in a neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Tripadee
Reviews.Content: For Paris this was a good modern well appointed room and a reasonable price. I liked the area which is a proper neighbourhood, kids going to school, people buying their bread from the bakery and a metro stop very nearby which makes getting around easy. The hotel is in a typical narrow town house and everything is small, including the super small lift. The room although small (it is Paris) was really well designed with no space wasted. The bathroom (shower only) was also well designed with expensive fittings and a very good shower. Bed was comfortable. It was also very warm and we could not get the air conditioning unit to work. It wasn't a big problem for us as we were there in November so we just opened our window a bit. On both the Saturday night and the Monday night I was woken by a strange repetitive sound, a little like a buzzing of a phone on vibrate but it kept on repeating. Sunday night was quiet. I solved the mystery when checking out I think. I asked the receptionist to check the occupancy for the previous few nights in the room above ours. It had been empty on the Sunday and I suspect that on the other nights the air conditioning unit had been left 'on' and was repeatedly trying to fire up as this was what happened with ours when we tried to get it to work. So I'd like to stay in this hotel again but I'd check very carefully that they had sorted out the problem with the air conditioning first, especially if going when likely to be warm. It is some time since we stayed there so it may well be sorted out. We had breakfast in Cafe Vavin very close by as the hotel breakfast was so expensive and we never saw anyone having breakfast there. When my husband suggested to the receptionist on checking out that they might get more takers if they made it a bit cheaper she said they couldn't undercut the other hotels in Paris. Obviously the concept of competition has passed her by! We did find the reception staff to be friendly and helpful. A word of warning, the hotel is on a tiny street and no-one including taxi drivers knows where it is so make sure you bring a print out of the map with you. I found out too late that it was just outside the central Paris maps in my guidebook and none of the people we asked knew of the street. If coming in from the airport by train the easiest thing to do is to get off at Port Royal and turn right when you come out of the station. Walk along the boulevard for about 10 mins until you see the Cafe de la Rotonde. Turn right and then right again to find Rue Chaplain Rive Gauche and the hotel is along here on your right.

Reviews.Title: “Double standards of rooms & bad management”
Reviews.Author: 754PhilippeO
Reviews.Content: I booked via internet (www. hrs.de) for 2 nights. The hotel offered me a room in a small area as a backyard, which obviously was not the standard rooms. There was no indication on the website, where I booked that there are such rooms. First surprise: the room does not have a real window; There is a mini window on the door (like the cells in prison). Have you been in a hotel room without window? Is this really allowed? 2nd surprise: whenever someone from the upper floor goes in the bathroom or toilette and takes a shower you can listen and "enjoy' the noise because the isolation is NIL! I made a complaint after the first terrible night, because the noise was really aknowing and actually realized that the room is not a hotel room to my understanding. The receptionist proposed me to write an email with my complaint to the manager. I have concluded that he does not communicate with him. I insisted that he has to contact him and then revert to me! He understood and even mentioned that some clients already had some complaints (great reaction) and that I will receive a feedback on the next day. . I mentioned that if they cannot change my room I would like to have at least a compensation ( I have paid for 2 nights in the "basement" 280 Euro) On the next day at breakfast and when I checked out there was a new receptionist. She did not speak to me about my request and problem, so I left it and decided to write my complaint. I was on a business trip and when I speak to someone about an issue 10 minutes I do not expect to remind people 3 times and explain again and again. Conclusion: nobody cares about customers in this hotel; Problem management is NIL; the employees are afraid to speak to the management; This is what I call Arrogant management style! Do you want to stay at a hotel where they treat clients as sheet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Convenient location, Easy Communication”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was recently updated and quite nice. The bathroom was especially nice in that the shower head lit up green and changed color from green to red. It was fun to turn the bathroom lights out and take a shower with the shower head as the light! The bed was comfortable and room clean. We had a double room and there were two large closets on either side to store our stuff, so that even though the room was typically smaller than American hotel rooms, we did not feel cramped. The windows opened up and it was very nice to have them open to the Paris spring weather. The first night was Friday and the restaurant below must be the place to be since it was quite lively (and noisy) until well after midnight. My smart phone has a "white noise" app on it though and so we turned that on and it did a good job drowning out the noise. There was no noise problem at all Saturday or Sunday, so perhaps it is just a Friday night problem. Otherwise, this hotel is on a quiet street and remarkably calm. There are many cafes and restaurants nearby that we found to be quite good and not at all touristy. That is what I liked most about this hotel - it wasn't surrounded by tourists or touristy shops and restaurants. I also liked that there were two Metro stops that were very close by (M4 Vavin and M12 N-D des Champs). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in a great area. 2 lines of metro are walking distance and the street is very quiet. Many bistrot are in the area for breakfast in case you don't want to have it in the hotel. (because is not included) Rooms clean, a bit small but confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen cash from security box”
Reviews.Author: Lim-Sin
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at this hotel for 4 days sometime in Oct 2011. It was a nice, clean hotel and certainly value for money. All the good things about the hotel i do agree. However please be careful about leaving spare cash in the security box. We left some cash in the security box and found out after we checked out we were missing a few hundred pounds. The "thief" was smart enough not to take the whole stack of cash to avoid immediate suspicion while we were still staying there, this meant when we opened our security box daily to check we saw the cash and assumed it was safe without counting. So be safe!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: greengal33
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel and found it to be in a perfect location. The decor is modern but very comfortable and the reception staff were there to assist whenever we needed it. The room was a perfect size and the bathroom was lovely and clean but the main draw was the location! It is right beside numerous really good restaurants, both traditional parisian bistro and more modern restaurants too. It is also only about 75m from the nearest metro station and a short stroll to the luxembourg gardens. The hotel provides a very reasonably priced breakfast but we never actually tried it as there were so many other options at our doorstep. This hotel is a perfect option for those who are looking for a comfortable bed in a central location at a reasonable price in a city which has a reputation for being overpriced. This is where I'll be staying when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellen value for money”
Reviews.Author: NikoHerlin
Reviews.Content: A very nice excellently situated hotel for a long weekend stay in Paris. Rooms are not large but very well equipped. A small mini bar is complimentary (no alcoholic bevarages) and refilled every day. The decor of the rooms is very nice and rooms are kept clean. Beds are very comfortable. Service in the reception is ok. The hotel is a bit from the large Bld Montparnasse so there's no traffic noise. However, as clients from the neighboring restaurant come out on the street to smoke, some noise can be heard especially in the rooms facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Serhei D
Reviews.Content: Positive: great layout, clean modern rooms, free wifi, free water mini bar. Negative: uncomfortable bed, thin walls, not helpful staff with attitude problems. Could be better for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Reception could be more friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Alexej C
Reviews.Content: Good location. The rooms facing the streets are are noisy in the evenings (restaurants in the street), so better asking rooms with windows to courtyard. The rooms are clean but not very soundproof. Young man on the reception refused to help us when we had problems to connect Internet in the lobby, he said he was very busy. A not bad hotel but certainly shall not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: kscott_1002
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in Paris. Location excellent for going for a run in the very close Luxumberg Gardens. Room size was good for my 5 day stay and loved the fact that the mini bar water/sodas were complementary. Service is basic but fine. I would stay again, fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shawnmontreal
Reviews.Content: I had spent a month researching every website in order to find the perfect hotel for our stay in Paris and I was hooked as soon as I read the online reviews. As we try to stay in different areas of the city on each visit, we were looking forward to staying in St-Germain-des-Prés. But, I was mislead by the Hotels.com website who positioned this hotel in St-Germain-des-Prés when in actual fact, it is located in Montparnasse : disappointment number 1. Upon arrival, the gentleman on duty was so busy texting, he barely noticed us arriving and I had to clear my throat loudly for him to look up. He was however very courteous and helpful once we got his attention. Disappointment number 2 : the room was so small, we could barely get our luggage in and actually move around the room. That problem was resolved however the next morning with a slightly larger room at no extra charge. However, the bathroom was smaller, so I guess there is compromise necessary whichever way you go. The chambermaid was FANTASTIC and helped make our transfer simple and painless. The friendliness and helpfulness of the front desk staff varied depending on who was on duty but for the most part, was OK. Please do not forget your earplugs as the noise level in this hotel is pretty high. Also, if you are into comfortable, fluffy beds and pillows, this hotel is definitely not for you. I actually had back problems in the morning because the bed was as stiff as concrete, very uncomfortable and not very restful nights. Elevator only carries 2 people at a time or one person and one piece of luggage. Be prepared to make a few trips up and down before you settle into your room. The area is great, safe and varied but I would walk away from the immediate neighborhood which is pricey and commercial. You are literally minutes away from the Luxembourg Gardens. There is a neighborhod pâtisserie who make the most divine traditional ham baguettes : pâtisserie Saint-Honoré. Back to this small boutique hotel; we arrived on our own steam but requested a transport to get us back to the airport. They were charging €40. We paid a deposit of €20 and had to give the rest to the driver. Upon arrival at the airport, the driver informs us that it actually only should have cost us €34 leaving the hotel with a nice little net profit of €6. I was knocked for a loop on this one, they should warn their drivers to be a little more discreet or else split the profits with them! Although the rooms were very clean, renovated tastefully and there was complimentary juice, water and soft drinks in the room, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SirDekkard
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for a few days in the summer, for my wife's 40th, but we had an excellent experience. Great little boutique hotel. Small rooms, but very cozy and certainly par for the course in a city like Paris. that being said we did have out own bathroom with shower and A/C. Again, not the norm in Paris. Very close to the Metro station at Vavin. But not close enough to a major street that there is a lot of noise. There were even a couple nice restaurants right by the hotel. I really can't say enough about this hotel. I even recommended it to my boss who also enjoyed his stay. If you want a nice, quaint, boutique, cool (A/C), clean, friendly and local hotel, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for price”
Reviews.Author: Katherine H
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't have a lot of rooms and is very small, but for the price we paid (154 EUR per night for a couple) and the location near the border of St. Germain and Montparnesse, it was awesome. The hotel was always clean, the front staff very polite and spoke enough English to converse easily with, and the rooms aren't huge but they are sufficient for two people as long as you don't have five giant luggage things. When you step outside and walk a few steps, you're immediately near a long street of restaurants and you are also across the street from both the metro and the taxi stand. If you walk about 7 minutes, you'll be at the Gare Montparnesse Train station, which can take you to other parts in France because the TGV and SNCF stop there. The hotel has some cute/eclectic decorations, and the room has a free mini bar that is replenished daily (Evian still water, sparkling water, Coke, Diet Coke, and orange juice). There is a breakfast buffet downstairs daily (not free) and you can order breakfast in your room but there isn't much else in terms of food or room service. The cleaning staff is thorough and everyday we came back to a lovely fresh room that smelled clean. Besides lack of room service (which you really don't need), the internet is very very slow. They have free wifi but sometimes it operates at crawl speeds during periods of heavy usage. The rooms also have thin walls, so every day we could hear people pounding up and down the stairs, conversing, and babies crying. Overall, a very pleasant stay, and definite must for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C H
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this charming hotel on a very quiet street. It's in a great location. We ate out most mornings because we wanted to be on the move and always found a great place to eat within walking distance. Our room was extremely clean and a nice size for two adults. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, although a day staff person wasn't able to provide information about the hotel's WiFi system. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a worm welcome”
Reviews.Author: jones c
Reviews.Content: Had a warm welcome when we got to the hotel. Fine hotel rooms with comfortable bed and good bathroom. Hotel is very clean all time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel if you want to avoid senseless police examinations.”
Reviews.Author: breive
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel reception staff we ever met (except good rooms cleaning and receptionict Kelly always ready to help). At checking in, they answered that we did not make any booking (!) - their PC had some technical problems and did not show our booking. When paying by credit card, pay attention to that the hotel takes deposit and then full amount, so you cannot use the deposit taken for other purposes for a week: if you have to pay 1500 euros, you will be debited for 2000 euros. The lift is permanently out of service. "I do not know", "I cannot help you", and finally "We do not care about booking.com or tripadvisor reviews, we are always full" - receptionist Arnaud said to us from time to time. Finally, big surprize was waiting us a day before checking out. My wife had a birthday and we were very in a hurry to be on time to Moulin Rouge. I tried to pay several days before but this was not possible for some technical problems again. The Moulin Rouge day receptionist Arnaud absolutely wanted that we make paiment this moment of big hurry. All luggage was in the room and we were leaving next day only, I asked to pay after the show or next day morning. Arnaud pulled out my credit card and metro tickets from my hands and called police. The police was very shocked. "Why you stayed in a such hotel", “I never met such a receptionist”, and "you should write a review about" - policemen said to me.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TheDomesticGoddess
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful boutique hotel for 4 days to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and what a little gem, I felt the need to write a review. From arriving at 11am we were welcomed by fantastic staff. Although our room wasnt ready we were able to leave bags and start our Paris experience. When we arrived back at the hotel later that day and went to our room we were both amazed and delighted by this 3 star hotel. It was beautifully decorated and very clean ( in fact cleaner than some 5 star hotels we have stayed in).The room also boasted a free non alchol mini bar in a fridge that we found very handy to store food in. Our room also had great air con. Throughout our stay our room was cleaned thoroughly every day and the free mini bar replenished every day.( water, soft drinks ) The staff were fantastic and very helpful. The area was brilliant as well, Loads of restaurants, the metro minutes away, fantastic little bakeries and about a 5 minute walk to Jardin de luxenbourg. We would definently recomend this little gem to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Style and Charm.. Paris personified”
Reviews.Author: mietteAuckland
Reviews.Content: This hotel, in a small quiet side street near the Luxembourg Gardens, is everything that epitomises the Paris experience - warm welcome, a guest salon in striking colours and design giving out on to a tiny courtyard, bedrooms although compact in size, decorated with that same flair that is evident throughout, and very well appointed bathrooms. An intelligent touch is the small refrigerator which contains juice and water which are included in the price of the room, handy also if you want to cool your own bottle of wine. Breakfast was extra, but with two price levels, so you had the option of unusual breads, like walnut and fig, carafes of freshly squeezed orange and delicious coffee, or you could help yourself to cereals and fresh fruits, cold meats and cheeses and eggs for the deluxe version.Just off the salon was a discreet internet corner. Everything about this hotel showed intelligent,careful thought about the needs of the guest and fortunately for us they were on the summer price band!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvesutiger
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with charming interior. The hotel only has few rooms so it's relatively private. There's a noisy restaurant on the front road so would recommend a room on the back end. The rooms have everything you need and are very clean. Lot of restaurants in the surrounding and metro is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel away from toursty Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nosus
Reviews.Content: Just popped over for a weekend on the Eurostar from London and got a metro to vavin station. The hotel is a little hard to find at first. however, after asking two extremely helpful Parisiens (one of whom went out of his way to show us the way, to our surprise!!), we found this little gem down a quiet side street off the main thoroughfare. Rooms were small but light and airy and cute! The room and bathroom was very clean. This is the real Paris. Plenty of lovely little eateries of the tourist tracks! Definitely recommended as an area to stay in at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Super location in the 6th”
Reviews.Author: Ianm467
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ranked at 3 stars, which signals that the rooms are on the small side and the overall presentation is modest. We found it to be clean, quiet and comfortable. The desk was staffed by a succession of very helpful youngish French people, not at all the stereotype of the rude Parisian. Breakfasts were good, served in a pretty little breakfast room/lounge space, although the price was not included in the room rate. The elevators are on the small side, so large people with luggage should be prepared to travel one at a time. The hotel is located just steps from the part of Boulevard Montparnasse where Hemingway, Picasso and their pals used to hang out. It is still very lively, and there is good shopping in the area. There is also a Metro station right at the corner, with direct service to the Left Bank and three major railway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: difman13
Reviews.Content: Great location if you wanta real Parisian experience. Not at all overly touristy. The staff was very nice and helpful especially with getting shuttles to and from the airport a heck of a lot cheaper than a taxi would have been. Very close to the metro, cafes and good restaurants, on a nice little street. The rooms are small, as is the case in most of Paris. The free minibar was a nice touch and the rooms were very clean and modern. Could've had more comfortable beds, but, they weren't terrible either. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke gets into rooms from Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: stephersnyc
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel for its: - free mini bar of water - free wifi - very clean and modern rooms - great location in Montparnasse (it is not near St. Germain des Pres as some sites have listed) However, I'm an allergy and asthma sufferer and am particularly sensitive to smells and cigarette smoke. And we had some cigarette smoke smells in our room. This may just be a common issue among certain hotels in Paris (one of the service reps downstairs said that it was normal for the hotel to smell this way). Even the towels smelled like smoke. This problem might be particularly evident as well because the weather was warm and the AC had not been turned on yet, we had to keep our windows open to keep from sweltering, and the smoke from smokers in the courtyard below came in very strongly (we were first in the 1st floor, then moved to the 2nd floor - both courtyard rooms). My friend (a smoker) stayed in the 5th floor with balcony and also experienced smoke from the ground floor (or perhaps the other rooms??) Overall, great location for a visit to Paris, and if you're a smoker or immune to the smell of smoke, this is a perfect hotel for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NobuatPeru
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for my business trip to Paris. Such a nice room! It is not that small. They said this hotel started 2008, that also explains why it is clean and looks new. During my stay, they said the drinks in mini-bar at the room is free, which contains Evian, cola etc. I take the breakfast in the room, which is nice service. In all, I highly recommend this hotel for the people who want nice and comfortable room in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: toni1056
Reviews.Content: I had no problems with this hotel at all. Great location. clean room. Front desk was helpful. Had a problem with the internet at first, but I was ok after that. Hotel wasn't hard to find at all and its right nearby the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Keep you eye on your belongings and the WI-FI is a joke.”
Reviews.Author: simhapurlion
Reviews.Content: Its located in a nice spot, quite at nights and close to lots of metro stations. Service at the front desk is okay depending on the person. The only thing was my wife's 200 dollar sunglasses were taken and a sweater. we didn't realize it until the day of the return since the whole time we were there it was cloudy and raining. Just make sure u keep ur suitcases locked and keep ur valuables in a safe they provide. The WIFI is a joke and it dosent work ever. The signal will show but nothing will come. There wont be anybody to help u with that.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Ykombi
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Fabulous location with stylish rooms. I half expected a small room tucked away somewhere in the hotel as I was travelling alone, but no - I got a good-sized room which I found clean and modern. I wanted to stay here more than one night!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Left Bank Lodging”
Reviews.Author: Scholar63
Reviews.Content: Well-located and beautifully maintained hotel, in quiet side street close to Vavin metro station, countless bus routes, and the brasseries of the Boulevard du Montparnasse (le Dome, La Rotonde, la Coupole). Excellent room, with marble bathroom (posh toiletries), flat screen TV, free wireless in room as well as in lobby. High quality buffet breakfast available, along with French and international newspapers. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Paris GEM”
Reviews.Author: BlueArsedFly
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to Paris together, we were not sure what to expect. I had wanted to book Best Western Villa Des Artistes but changed to Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche at the last minute. After hauling our luggage on the Metro and traipsing past some road repairs, it was such an oasis of calm when we arrived at its pretty lobby. We loved our room, with its Josephine Baker mural above a large bed. Furnishings were very tasteful, the wardrobes were adequate with its internal safe. I particularly liked the complimentary bar which was a factor in choosing this hotel. The bathroom was light and airy, overlooked the small courtyard and neighbourhood rooftops. Freshening up here was a delight with premium complimentary toiletries and modern fittings. The staff were discrete and polite, although the manager was a bit aloof. Staff were helpful with booking tours and taxis. However, the receptionist sent us too far to Montparnasse for the L'Open bus stop, when the nearest one was around the corner on Boulevarde Raspalli! Location is ideal - far from crowds but just next to Vavin Metro, and near iconic cafes such as Le Rotonde as well as the Luxembourg Gardens. The Paris Metro is amazingly efficient and we never had to wait more than a few minutes for a train. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: hvitabjorn
Reviews.Content: The location is fine but the hotel is not. First of all we came early (noon) and left our luggage since the room was not ready. When we came back five hours later our luggage was unattended on the floor some 2 meters from the hotel door. No staff in the lobby and finally someone showed up some few minutes later. It is an easy place to steel luggage. The rooms are VERY small even the largest ones. I have stayed at the nearby Meridian Montparnasse in a room 3 times larger for the same price! The wireless Internet connection is VERY slow. Worst of all this small hotel is in between residental apartments and the walls are thin. There was a party with loud music behind the wall and getting to sleep was not easy. One last point. They charge your credit card instantly for the full payment if you book on their website. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but You Decide”
Reviews.Author: Arkamus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Chaplain is a new boutique hotel in the 5th district of Paris. It was a pleasant stay, and while we got an authentic feeling of a Parisian neighborhood, I am not sure if I'd stay here again.The hotel itself is charming. It's near the Vavin Metro in the Montparnasse area. Lots of shops and restaurants and the place is buzzing at night. But very few people speaking english. The first restaurant we ate in (italian around the corner), our server spoke no english. Just Great! But Raspali or St.Michael Blvds nearby are great places to shop for clothes. Hotel service was eh. We checked in, but the girl from Senegal had an attitude problem. We overlooked it. Other staff were fine. The rooms are nice and clean, but a bit small. The bathrooms were very modern and the shower head was memorable. It lights up depending on whether the water is cold (blue) or hot (red). Location wise, it has pluses and minuses. The plus point being you're away from all the tourists, but you're a bit far from the attractions. The green double-decker bus is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Don't go through the famous Luxeumbourg Gardens (unless you want to) to get on the double-decker. Theres a stop closer to the hotel as we learned later. Once you're on the bus, you're set. To go to specific attractions like the Louvre from the hotel, just take a cab. It's not that expensive as we discovered. Be sure to grab a hotel business card. It has a map on the back so if the driver is unsure of the hotel street coming back, show the card. I would recommend the hotel, but you have to decide if stepping right outside your hotel door and walking to famous attractions is more important than authentic experience of Paris. But even this hotel went for $250 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, not the best value”
Reviews.Author: DiscoveryTwo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean hotel with friendly and knowledgeable staff. We did have multiple cold showers, although the wireless internet is free - don't count on it for work (lacks bandwidth and has intermittent signal), and the location is a fair distance from the key attractions. I don't think for the price, this is the best option. Many hotels in St Germain (centrally located) are as nice or even better for similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: bakedbe3ns
Reviews.Content: Everything in Paris is expensive and this hotel represents good vlaue relatively. The rooms are small (as they are all over Paris) but very comfortable and nicely furnished. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Caring staff on a quiet street.”
Reviews.Author: SMT968
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Hotel Chaplain during our recent week-long trip to Paris, and we had a great experience. The front desk staff were incredibly nice and helpful, and the hotel is run very well. Hotel Chaplain is also located on a quiet street in a great part of Paris with some great restaurants and bistros just around the corner and easy access to the Metro. The hotel is very well run and impeccably clean. You'll also find free beverages in the in-room fridge (absolutely unheard of anywhere else), modern bathroom amenities and a real hair-dryer. (Sounds funny, but not always something I've had when I've stayed in Paris.) The rooms are quite small as they always are in this great city, but well appointed. You'll also find plenty of boulangerie very near the hotel and can walk to the Luxembourg Gardens to eat your morning pastry in less than 10 minutes. We did find that the hotel WiFi was slow going and my friends who ordered the Express Breakfast in the morning had mixed results - coffee addicts can never wait - but in general we were all very happy at Hotel Chaplain.

Reviews.Title: “best stay”
Reviews.Author: oanapaskoviti
Reviews.Content: best stay,best location,and very clean!!!!we enjoyed our 2 nights !congrads for everything....oana &elios

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ChiGirl78
Reviews.Content: I could not have picked a better value or location in Paris! This hotel was everything I wanted for the two nights I stayed. I chose it because it was close to the Luxembourg Garden, as well as the work event I was attending. It also had sensational restaurants around the corner, easy access to Metro, and safe location. The room was the perfect size for a single traveler, and the theme of my room was Marilyn Monroe. The bathroom was modern and spotless, with a nifty mood light shower head. The bed was comfy, and the storage was perfect for clothes. Free minibar, too! The staff were all very helpful. They gave me good directions, helped me with my box of promo materials, and tried with all their might to get me a taxi for Monday morning (to no avail...but not their fault!!) La Rotonde is right at the corner, and the Garden is literally a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Vavin metro stop just around the corner, too.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Parisien”
Reviews.Author: nkastelein
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in relaxed 'feelgood' neighbourhood just outside the busy places, but it feels near the action. Nice first stroll in the Jardin the Luxembourg before exploring the rest of Saint-Germain-des-Pres and Paris, good restaurants in the streets nearby and the metro just around the corner. And of course: try exploring Paris by bike, that are 50 meters from the hotel. Rooms are clean. And although not spacious, they offer a pleasant place to be, also for relaxing during daytime. Perfect, large bed! We'd come back here! breakfast in your room without extra charge is a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome hotel, can't recommend highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: J0_mc
Reviews.Content: 1. Was the hotel close to things (e.g. transport, attractions, restaurants)? 2 mins walk to various buses and trains, which will get you anywhere around Paris in no time. 2min walk to about 50 restaurant choices. 20min walk to the Latin Quarter and Notre Dame. 2. Was the hotel in a safe area? Very safe. 3. Was there much noise at night? Our room was on the first level, facing the street, right above a restaurant, so unfortunately we did get quite a bit of noise from restaurant patrons until early hours of the morning. 4. What was the quality and cleanliness of the hotel furniture and fittings like (e.g. bed, lock-up safe, shower)? Very romantic, elegant and cosy fittings. Everything in working condition and ultra-modern. Cleaned daily. Room safe present. 5. Do the hotel staff provide a good service (e.g. competence, attitude, availability)? Very friendly and knowledgeable about the city. Always available. 6. What were the hotel amenities like (e.g. breakfast, restaurant, pool, bar, car parking)? Breakfast available, but we didn't partake due to the easy availability of cafe breakfasts nearby. Guests are able to borrow / exchange books from the book shelf in the lounge area downstairs, which was a great idea. 7. Did the room come with extras (e.g. minibar, TV, internet, air-con, tea making facility)? Free drinks from the minibar, including soft drinks (not alcohol)!! Tea facilities available in the main lounge area. Air conditioned rooms but you can also open the windows instead. 8. Other / general comments: We loved the location, value for money, service, and design of this hotel, and will definetly return if we ever go back to Paris. Please consider staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: tervol1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche for five nights. Our room was on the first floor, facing the small courtyard. The bathroom also had a window to the courtyard. The only downside was that we couldn't keep the window open as there always seemed to be someone smoking just below the window. The room and the bathroom were modern and spotlessly clean and large enough for a comfortable stay. The free minibar with refreshments stocked daily was a very nice touch. The free wi-fi connection worked perfectly during our stay. What we liked most about the hotel is the location. The neighbourhood is very nice with lots of good restaurants and cafes close by. The hotel is tucked away in a side street just off the main throughfares Boulevard du Montparnasse and Rue Vavin. The metro stop Vavin is just around the corner from the hotel and even more metro connections are available from Montparnasse Bienvenüe within a few minutes walk. It's also very easy to get to the hotel from the CDG airport with the Air France bus that stops at Gare Montparnasse. From there it's only a 10 minute easy walk to the hotel, without having to carry your luggage up and down steps at metro stations. We didn't try the hotel breakfast, instead we just grabbed some croissants from the bakery down the street and headed to the Jardin du Luxembourg park that is just a few blocks away. There are also a couple of grocery shops nearby. The staff was really friendly and professional and made the whole stay memorable and a pleasure. We will definitely stay again at Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche!

Reviews.Title: “great neighborhood, great stay”
Reviews.Author: klsalas
Reviews.Content: I was looking at Paris hotels and realized that I had never written a much deserved commendation for Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche. My wife and I traveled to Paris with friends and we were in Paris for about a half a week. The hotel looked like a perfect combination of style and value, and it was well reviewed here on TripAdvisor, but we had never stayed in this particular part of the left bank and knew little of it. Although ordinarily I would expect a hotel review to address the hotel first, in this case what really surprised me about this trip was how much I enjoyed the neighborhood. I have been to Paris a few times before and have seen most of its best known sights. As I will further address in a minute the hotel itself was all I hoped for but if readers would pass on Hotel Chaplain for a hotel in a more touristed neighborhood I think they would miss out on what I perceived to be a very authentic Parisian experience. The hotel is literally only blocks from the South side of Luxemborg gardens and the Cimetiere Montparnasse, Henri Cartier Bresson foundation and Catacombs were nearby. Also some of the best historic brasseries and restaurants are just up the block at Vavin metro -- including Le Coupole, Select, La Rotonde and Le Dome. We also ate a superior local restaurant called Le Timbre nearby. The hotel is also very well served by Metro and within easy walking distance for those in reasonable shape to all of the left bank and riverside sights, (Eiffel Tower, 45 minutes, Pont de Artes, Louvre, Orsay, Rodin Museum, 25 minutes, Orsay, Notre Dame, 25 minutes). I should point out that although some of the surrounding blocks are lively the area around the hotel was peaceful. We had heard of some complaints about noise from local bars but didn't experience that at all. The hotel was small and stylish. It was quite a value for Paris. Some pictures are attached. Our room was spacious and had all the expected amenities as well as a characteristic rooftops/courtyard view from a small faux terrace. Our room was quiet and comfortable but what set this small gem apart was the very attentive staff, including but not limited to Melanie, who bent over backwards to meet every need. We very much enjoyed our stay and hope to return to Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche on our next Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & friendly service! Great location near the metro! We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: gilly22OR
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Chaplain was excellent. The location was within a minutes walk from a metro station (subway) and very close to several restaurants and shops. It was nice not being too close to the hustle and bustle of downtown Paris. Especially since it was only a 2-5 minute metro ride to the center. The service was great! Both Michel and the young lady working at the front desk were extremely helpful in pointing my wife and I in the right direction when it came to directions, eating, organizing taxi services etc. I would definitely stay there again. The AC unit in the room was very good as well. While we were in Paris, the temperature was around 90-94 degrees. Our room had no problem staying right at 70 throughout the day and night. The FREE WiFi was great too! There were only a few very small items we would have loved to see changed. 1. Complimentary breakfast. This was the only hotel we stayed at that did not include a complimentary breakfast. 2. A bigger room. Our room was very nicely appointed, but was a bit small. To be honest, this really isn't all that big of a deal considering the vast majority of hotels around Europe have smaller rooms than what you would see around the US. I hope this review helps any folks out there looking to book a hotel around Paris. If you are looking for a comfortable stay with excellent friendly service, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. Thanks again Michel & the young lady at the front desk (sorry, we never got her name). You both made our stay a memorable one! Audra & Brian

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: gfhbennett
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Great location on left bank; 5 mins walk to Jardin du Luxembourg and 10 mins to St. Germain. Comp. tea & coffee in reception with classy seating area. Rooms spotless (particularly fantastic shower!) helpful & friendly staff. We booked 6 months in advance so got a great value rate - approx. 100 euros cheaper than rack rate. Would recommend for couples. Anyone interested in using Velib cycle hire to explore Paris there is a bike station just 1 min. from hotel. Will definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: love_katie
Reviews.Content: Incredible stay - the hotel is in an amazing location - away from the tourist traps, but very close to the metro (Vavin station), and with a bike share post right nearby! The bike share is highly recommended - buy a ticket for €1, and use any bike for free for the first half hour! There are spots all over Paris, very easy to use! The hotel was spotless, roomy and a beautiful design - the view is lovely and the staff were wonderful. Would stay there again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, nice location, very clean, modern and staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: murraytfe
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, nice location, very clean, modern and staff very helpful. The hotel is situated in a nice area of Paris, with a metro/subway station nearby. We found the zone was a residential area, so you get to see real Parisians. It was safe to walk the streets in the evening. There are plenty plenty of good places to eat nearby. The staff are friendly and helpful and all speak English. If I were to go to Paris in the future, I would definitely choose the hotel again. John

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: misty2001
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights with my teenage daughter at Hotel Chaplain. We arrived at Orly and took the Orlybus to metro Vavin. Very easy, quick, and affordable. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to metro, and fabulous restaurants and boulangeries on every corner. It's on a very quiet street, next to a Creole restaurant that was always full but we never tried unfortunately. We stayed in a classic room which was small, but fine for us. Window opened out to a beautiful, quiet courtyard. Refrigerator stocked everyday with water, juice, cokes which were free, was a nice touch. Luxembourg garden is a 5 minute walk. Staff at desk were very helpful. We didn't have breakfast for 14 Euros, because of the boulangerie on the way to the gardens was wonderful! Loved the location because it wasn't in the middle of all of the tourists. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Parisadventurer
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to Metro, quiet, comfortable, staff very helpful, good English, helpful local advice. Would definitely use again. Good value for money. Clearer directions or better external signage would have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: AmicusTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this intimate hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the room, breakfasts, and location. We stayed in a club queen room (# 50) with furnishings that mirrored those on the website. The room was newly renovated, very clean, modern, and quiet (we were separated from the other 3 rooms on our floor by a door). The free minibar is a nice gesture (even though we used it mostly for storing our wine). The only drawback was the slippery bathtub with the small glass "shield". Simply throwing a hand towel on the bottom of the tub saved us a sure trip to the ER. The hotel is just one block from the metro as well as delightful brasseries and restaurants. We had a wonderful 2 course dinner for two plus bottle of wine for 100 euros at Rotunde. Diagonally across the street from Rotunde, we had a fabulous seafood dinner (reservations suggested). Although we ate breakfast at the hotel twice (wonderful spread), we later decided to try the nearby, and cheaper, options. There's a movie theater on the same block (not scuzzy as someone else suggested); and a laundromat one street away. We found the location ideal -- not touristy and very safe. We typically walked to many sites, or alternately took the metro. No need for cabs. It was also convenient when we had to get to Charles de Gaulle airport. The front desk directed us to walk 3 blocks along Rue Montparnasse until we reached the Port Royal station where we caught a direct train to CDG Airport. Other guests have suggested looking for the Irish Pub sign when searching for the Rue Chaplain -- excellent suggestion (it's across from the Rotunde). brasserie). We had a delightful stay at this small, stylish, and reasonably priced holel.

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable, modern, artsy boutique hotel- Gem- Free minibar each day!”
Reviews.Author: travellighteatheavy
Reviews.Content: Rooms Come in ALL sizes. The smallest room (which we stayed in) was fine. Large bathroom with large window and LED lights in the shower! Comfortable bed. Large closets. Small but livable. Get larger with price (I saw whilst maid was cleaning) and they were extremely spacious. FREE minibar replenished EACH day with large water bottle, two sodas, orange juice and fruit juice. Excellent! VERY clean Location Further from the "major" sites but around corner from jardin de luxembourg. Cab from Eiffel tower was 10 euro. Rue Brea (around corner) had adorable shops and small and fresh bakery. Service Very good. They ran out of larger croissants and the owner went to the bakery to buy some just for us, and even brought other pastries she thought we would like. I Suggest not to eat breakfast there though (14 euro per person) and they get the pastries etc from the bakery around the corner (which sells them for 2 euro each and a coffee for 2 euro) Had converters to borrow. Wireless internet offered but was not working whilst we were there. Outdoor (tiny) courtyard Lobby had shelves with a huge variety of books on travel, history, art, decor, fashion, classics, magazines. It was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug36
Reviews.Content: Went away to Paris for a long weekend in March 2009 and stayed in this lovely Boutique hotel. We had a shuttle service from the airport to the hotel which I was glad about as I think we would have struggled to find it if we hadn't. The hotel is lovely. We had one of the rooms in the courtyard on the groundfloor which was very pretty. The room itself was a little on the small side but the bathroom was a really nice size with a fantastic shower and the bed was extremely comfortable, did not have one bad nights sleep for the whole stay. The free mini bar with the soft drinks was a god send at the end of a day sight seeing and just what we needed when we got back to the hotel. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but walked to one of the nearby patesseries and had freshly baked pastry and coffee which was great. The hotel was a bit of a walk away from the sights but if like us you don't mind walking everywhere (it truely is the best way to see a city) then it would be ideal for you. There are plenty of restaurants nearby to eat in. We ate in a traditional French restaurant and a Thai restaraunt during our stay. We also found a Canadian bar close to Notre Dame and a Cuban bar near to the hotel both of which were great for a few drinks (or coffee at the Canadian bar on a particularly cold day!) We saw most of the sights on foot, the Eifel tower was the longest walk as the hotel is over the other side of the city, but we did use the tube and the red bus tour as well to ensure that we got to see all of the city during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but that's all”
Reviews.Author: traveller_lou
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the rooms were nice although small. The hotel was a long way out of the centre although there was a metro stop nearby. The reception staff spoke English but the rest did not which was a little problematic when they were sent to the room to deal with problems.... Our safe didn't work and when a member of staff (no English) tried and found the same, the receptionist suggested that our passports, money etc would be ok in the broken safe since the staff had worked there for 20 years and so we could trust them. What???!!! We weren't offered a room change and had to insist on this, which they seemed to find strange.... The hairdryer was faulty and rather than send another, the non-English speaking maid came to test it in another room. She then brought what she claimed was the same one, which miraculously worked again. I think she just swapped it, but why imply that we didn't know how to use hairdryers by teaching us what to do (i.e. press the button)? After using the working safe in the new room, when we returned in the evening, the safe wouldn't open and was showing an error message. The receptionist had to type in the access code and we had to re-programme it. There was no way we made a mistake with the code and wonder if someone had tried to tamper with it during the day? Who knows. Unfortunately there were no coffee/tea facilities in the rooms. We overheard on the last day that we could use these facilities in reception. However there was a charge, which seemed a little mean! Also, the receptionists were not very helpful at all - we were only given a tourist map on the second day of five when we asked for directions. Also, we asked for the nearest internet cafe to print our return flight tickets. We were told there were none nearby and hardly any in Paris. We then asked at a patisserie nearby who gave us directions immediately - 3 mins down the main road! We then went to pick up our cases and saw that they had a laptop in reception for guests to use!!! Very strange. I wouldn't recommend staying here. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really wrong with it -- just not memorable...”
Reviews.Author: templebar8
Reviews.Content: Especially if you can compare it to an exceptional boutique hotel (see my review of Secret de Paris). Chaplain Rive Gauche was just okay, even without considering the leaps and bounds experience we had at Secret. The service was uneventful, the most interesting thing in the room was the rain shower head and the noise at the night (thin walls, rooms right next to the elevator/stairway and numerous bars/restaurants right below) was too much. What sealed the coffin for us was the lack of service we got when we checked out. We asked if we could get a cab and the woman at the front desk literally picked up the phone, held it to her ear for 2 seconds and put it back down and said there was nothing she could do because there were no cabs in the area. We ended up walking outside and getting a cab to Secret de Paris -- the epitome of a boutique hotel and only second to the BoBo in Buenos Aires in our affections.

Reviews.Title: “Tourists should stay a little closer to attractions, otherwise nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krystal D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. We booked directly with hotel. The room was small (which was expected for Paris), room for a bed, 2 bedside tables, closet and small desk built into corner. I made sure i unpacked both our suitcases and moved around the 2 chairs, so that there was sufficient walking space. The safe didn't work, but we don't usually use them anyway. They provided a small cooler fridge, kept in a hiding space in the wall. It kept things cool but not cold. Air conditioning worked well. Bed was very hard (we arent used to hard beds) but after the first 2 nights we got used to it. The toilet roll holder was positioned almost directly over the toilet meaning you couldn't quite sit straight on the toilet. But the bathroom was quite a good size. There was a shower over a bathtub, but the shower screen was small and not moveable - less than 2 feet and I found that a lot of water sprayed onto the floor. There was a lift available, however it is very tiny (it states max 4 capacity) and we managed to fit 2 people and 2 medium suitcases in, but we were squished. The hotel gives you a large key for your hotel door, however you have to hand this in at reception every time you leave the hotel, which is really great as it is one less thing you have to carry with you all day. There was some construction going on outside, but we couldn't hear it from our room. Vavin metro station is only 5 minute walk away and can be a little tricky to find the hotel from there the first time, Shannon's pub is located on the corner of rue Jules chaplain, so if you get lost, just look out for the pub. The reception staff were very helpful on the phone when we arrived from CDG airport. Also there is a laundromat just across the street, it is unmanned and you will need change to use it. From memory it cost 1 euro for wash powder, 7 euros for wash and dryer was 1 euro per 10 minutes. Hotel is also located near montparnasse observation tower which is quite a good alternative to Eiffel tower. There is also a Velib bike station located across the street from hotel which we found very handy as well. Breakfast was available at hotel for around 11-14 euros, however we never tried it.

Reviews.Title: “Chaplain - great hotel, price and location”
Reviews.Author: Marina709
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via their website and got a great internet rate. The hotel is exactly how you see it on the pictures, nice clean rooms and bathrooms (the shower-head changes colours). Very good location on the Left Bank, just a couple of metro stations to Saint Germain and Notre Dame. Will definitely stay there again when returning to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachana4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Chaplain for 2 non days and found it to be comfortable and well located. On our first night however, the room that we were allocated (no. 14) had a strong, unpleasant smell (the front desk subsequently requested the carpet to be cleaned). If it wasn't for that experience we would have rated the hotel more highly. While the rooms are compact (typically Parisian), they are well appointed. And the downstairs lounge with internet access was handy. Michel, the concierge, was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to Chaplain Rive Gauche”
Reviews.Author: CANINLON
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Paris for leisure and business and would vote Chaplain Rive Gauche as one of the best hotels in the "mid" price range. Yes, the rooms are small-ish, as compared to some of the business hotels based in LaDenfense or further into Montparnasse...But it has a personality, the service is attentive and friendly, and the location is great for tourists and the metro for business. Clean modern bathrooms, free refreshments fridge and wifi are available. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff, comfortable - overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jtolenick
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at Hotel Chaplain. It's a small hotel tucked away in a nice area, close to the metro and Luxembourg park and within walking distance to all of the popular sites. Many nice shops and good restaurants nearby. It also is a sleek, trendy type of hotel that was very comfortable to be in. Most of the staff spoke English and tried to be helpful. Michel was excellent and provided us great service with directions and restaurant recommendations. His service far exceeded anything I could have expected. The only negatives I can think of that are not really a problem for our trip were that the breakfast selection wasn't all that good and they didn't offer many TV channels, and none in English. We didn't spend much time in our room on the trip and we ate our breakfast at local restaurants and bakeries (they are awesome), so all was good for us. Would definitely recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a quiet street, but still very close by to a lot”
Reviews.Author: Romperaska
Reviews.Content: I got a tip about this hotel from a collegue who stayed there some years ago and I do not regret choosing this hotel. It was very nice. The staff e-mailed and offered us a car with driver picking us up and driving us back to the airport. That was such a nice thing and helped us a lot. We thought the rooms and the hotel was very nice. The matresses was a bit hard to us though and I still miss the possibility having 2 blankets in one king size bed ;) We choose Club King room. Rooms are ok in size, but I missed a bit bigger space for my clotes. The rooms had nice flatscreen LG TV with BBC world, Italian tv, german and french. Not many channels, but enough. The minibar was also free and served water and soft drinks, not alcohol. Bathrooms very nice, cool feature the showerhead had lights in it, green - blue and red. We ate breakfast at the hotel the last 2 days at our stay and it was very good. We got choises of bread, cereals, yoghurts etc. It was better than going out eating white bread and cakes I must say (though the hotel served that too). The area also had a lot of great restaurants which we tried. I especially want to reccoment the Rotound which was close by. Metro was also nearby and so easy to use. We also walked to the Jardin de Luxembourg which was just 2-3 minutes away. I loved the neighbourhood and I would absolutely reccomend the hotel and the area to you. I think my travel company will agree with me, we were all saying that we enjoyed our stay and found the staff very nice and helpful, speaking good english too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy1234
Reviews.Content: Location was good ,Not to close to the river so it was quite.Only complaint i had was when we took taxis they could not find the hotel .we took 5 different taxis and they all had to stop people and ask directions.They were all really nice and din't charge us extra for taking longer to find our hotel. Opon arriving hotel rec.wasn't very helpful .But we only saw her onces after that the entire staff was very helpful. Room was small but this is Paris. Breakfast was ok except they really need to lear how to cook crossants they were always burned. 14euro was a bit much for the breakfast.But where in Paris can you get 5 cups of coffee for 14 euro . We would stay again all in all it was a good experence.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, comfortable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: julesjulesjules
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the Metro stop Vavin on a quiet street within 5 minutes of one of the most beautiful parks in Paris. The courtyard in the middle of the hotel is quaint. Beds are comfortable. Very clean and friendly. Would have liked to have the tea bags replaced overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Welcoming and Good Area for First Time Visitors”
Reviews.Author: Seat28B
Reviews.Content: I booked this for one night on the basis of recommendations on Trip Advisor. Arriving by train in Gare du Nord, it is a simple and quick process to get to the hotel by either Metro (Ligne 4 to Vavin) or RER (Ligne B to Denfert Rochereau and then switch to Metro Ligne 4). I arrived at 11pm and the first thing that struck me was the welcome at reception. Not only was it friendly, but I was also told about the free wireless connection in the room and the fact that the minibar was free. It is unusual to find a receptionist in any city who would do this, but in Paris it is unprecedented. The room itself was a good size by Parisian standards, particularly the bathroom. Be warned that the bed is extremely hard and while this suited me fine, it may not be to everyone's liking. There were also some minor issues with the bathroom - for example, the shower is inclined to splash everywhere and the bathroom itself was cold in the morning - but in a 3 star hotel, these are not major issues. I had an early start so ate breakfast there. While it was pretty expensive at € 14, the quality of the food was good albeit limited. For example, the orange juice was freshly squeezed but it was the only juice available. It was typical continental fare - cheese, cold meats, yogurts, breads and pastries. Overall, this is a very good small hotel and appears to be staffed by people who actually like their jobs. Having lived in Paris in the past, I also think that this is a great area for visitors, as it is accessible to all of the main tourist sites but is relatively quiet with some nice local restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dec879
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, in the eastern time. The room was very clean and the staff were friendly. Location is near by the metro system and it is easy to get to hotel by RER direct from CDG. Free mini bar which contains juice, soda and water also free wifi in your room. We will most definitely return on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, clean and stylish but otherwise not so great...”
Reviews.Author: shellp27
Reviews.Content: I felt the hotel was very clean and trendy in a great location. I was disallusioned though by everything else. My flight was cancelled due to a blizzard in Colorado and when I gave the hotel notification 2 nights prior they were not willing to do anything about it. I understood but was disappointed they couldn't give me another night there at a break in the higher price they advertised. The customer service just wasn't there - the hotel staff was very aloof and most of them didn't speak much english at all despite what their web site stated. I did not find them to be very nice or helpful. The room and bathroom were very clean, trendy and comfortable. The rooms are not well insulated though and I could hear my neighbors and the loud elevator at all hours of the night. That would be my largest complaint. The rooms are also very small. The internet connection in the lobby is all in french there so if you plan to use that for information it isn't very helpful. I would not stay there again, mostly due to the aloof staff and lack of room insulation for a good sleeping environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: minimouse13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and was very impressed. Location is great - Vavin is on line 4 which seves a number of handy metro stops such as Chatelet and Saint Germain des Pres. Vavin has some lovely cafes and there is a great bakery around the corner from the hotel with fantastic baguettes and quiches. Hotel is walking distance from Notre dame, Seine, jardin de luxebourg. Friendly staff and nice added touch of free internet and complimentary drinks from the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, well located stylish comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: IngeborgLon
Reviews.Content: We spent my birthday weekend there and had a wonderful time in this friendly, comfortable, quiet and clean hotel. I have stayed in many higher starred hotels in Paris, but this was much better. Very good value for money. Coming from London and Frankfurt, it is very well located on Ligne 4 coming from Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est and within walking distance to St. Germain and the Seine and from there the Marais. I would recommend it highly and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: leautier
Reviews.Content: Great location, in a nice neighborhood, with easy access to the business sections of Paris. A few rooms, not huge, but recently renovated, hence very pleasant to sleep, and work. A great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, Very well located.”
Reviews.Author: sweiser
Reviews.Content: I just spent 10 days with my wife at this hotel. The hotel met our expectations. It is very well located between Montparnasse and St. Germain, and very close to the subway. Like expected, room is very small. But very clean and excellent bathroom. Internet signal had good quality but slow speed. Good option.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jamesk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is tucked away on a quiet street in the 6th near Luxembourg Gardens (possibly the most beautiful garden in Paris)--you can walk to the Seine in 10 minutes. The lobby is simple and chic. I had room #12 which was small but very stylish and overlooked the hotel entrance--not much of a view, but perfectly fine. The bed was comfortable...there was a little table and chair in the room...a small fridge stocked with complimentary beverages (nice touch)...and free wifi (another nice touch). My favorite part was the bathroom--gorgeous, modern, super chic. Fragonard toiletries made it perfect. Staff was beyond helpful and there is a very nice breakfast served in the lobby. I would definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ukgogotravel
Reviews.Content: This was just what I was looking for... I lovely, peaceful hotel right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Paris. Chaplain was so quiet, situated on side street, yet the Metro was only about 2 minutes walk. Yes, the rooms are small but absolutely perfect for a night away....and SO clean and well presented. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Always worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: zinho007
Reviews.Content: The Chaplain is certainly one of those adresses that you won't find on the mega search websites but has a special charme in a nice area between Jardin du Luxembourg and Montparnasse. If you want to give the personal touch to your stay in Paris then this address is for You.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel to fully enjoy Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jena9
Reviews.Content: Very good location - quiet yet easy to reach, good restaurants very close - try the one next door (Madagascar-Mauricius kitchen), very clean, pleasant modern design, helpful people...

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel on a quiet street.”
Reviews.Author: mountainportal
Reviews.Content: Nice "pop art" decor and modern bath shower. The shower and water pressure was great after a long day of walking in Paris. Room was very clean ,but, very small and not easy to hang out in for two people. There was a queen bed and cabinets on each side and a small table and chair that took up almost all the space. The staff was friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Paris for a little getaway”
Reviews.Author: nounou24
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel - the decor was modern, the Classic room was small but well furnished & comfortable. The bathroom was a great size with all new fixtures and we had two windows that opened up to a beautiful courtyard in the middle of the hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced..”
Reviews.Author: kellyrila
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings of this hotel. Before I arrived, I have high expectation as it rank #40 in tripadvisor, and the room rate is quite expensive in terms of a 3-star hotel. Our room is 201, room is spacious in parisian standard, bathroom is okay with shower room but water leaking out as it's not properly sealed. Location is great, just beside the main dining street in montparnasse, and many metro stations, bus stations nearby. The famous "La Couple" cafe is there. The bad things here are no real air conditioning, room not sound-proofed. We can hear noises from the lift, staircases, and even everything from the room next to us. So it's embarrassing and we cannot sleep well for the whole night as our neighbour too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and well placed with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kerjean
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel and a random find but we intend to use it again. It was particularly well positoned for us as we live in Brittany but it's also very close to the centre of Paris and we walked through the nearby Jardins de Luxembourg to the river. The hotel is very pretty. We had an easily accessible room on the ground floor. It felt spacious and was well designed. The only slight negative was that the wet room needed care - the shower produced a lot of water! I liked the simple breakfast with a delicious fresh fruit salad. The crockery and napery were stylish and the whole ambience was relaxing and welcoming with very charming staff. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect, reasonably priced location to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: aberry324
Reviews.Content: My wife I and I stayed here for our honeymoon in October 2009 and had a fantastic time. We thought the rooms were lovely (and reasonably priced), the staff friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect - just next to the metro. We'd highly recommend this hotel for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lucy1871
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Paris for my 40th Birthday and I chose this hotel based on the good reviews here. The service was great, the room was by far one of the best rooms we've ever stayed in. I'm a bit of a germaphobe and have been known to travel with my own cleaning supplies for hotel bathrooms, but this bathroom was pristine. The room was small, but no smaller than any other room we've had in Paris. Rooms are small in Europe, that's just the way it is. The location is perfect, super close to the metro and there are plenty of restaurants all around. The breakfast was fine, certainly not the finest pastry in Paris, but good enough for a quick bite and a quick cafe before heading out for the day. Loved this hotel and we'll stay here the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and ideal”
Reviews.Author: Fuffeta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for Business if it is near the exhibition senter .Also its near the center of Paris and all the sightseeing you want to visit. Its my second time staying there and i wouldnt change it .The area is very good ...lots of shops to eat or drink ...!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: duma3
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel located on a quiet street in the 6th district. 6th discrit is a real Paris, not the tourist center. Here You can meet real parisians. The hotel is located 1 min from vavin metro station, near the famous rotonda cafe. I will highly recommend one to start the morning and to finish the day with a real hot chocoloate in rotonda (and not with a choco they serve in the tourist cafes) The hotel is small, however the rooms a relatively spacious for france. Very clean, very comfortable bed. The staff was friendly. Really nice hotel, would stay there once again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in handy location”
Reviews.Author: CJHinGloucs
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but newly decorated, modern and clean with everything you needed for a visit to Paris. Comfortable beds and good fixtures in the bathrooms. Staff very friendly and helpful. Quiet street but very close to good metro station (direct line from Gare du Nord). Liked the neighbourhood - lots of restaurants, cafes, boulangerie etc. Close to Luxembourg Gardens

Reviews.Title: “small deluxe hotel at excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: george269
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this wonderful hotel, tastefully decorated, where everything works, centrally located, with excellent breakfast and service.

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: pcmeadery
Reviews.Content: We revisited the Chaplain after a first time in the summer - first time guided principally by the enthusiastic comments from tripadvisor. The hotel hasn't changed: great location in Montparnasse and excellent rooms for central Paris. Comfortable beds, excellent bathrooms (with a real bath), and moderately noise-free (although in Paris one never seems to be able to escape the gurgle of the pipes from the bathrooms upstairs). Great staff, wonderful service. Breakfast is good value, even if it seems a bit steep at $20 per person. The hotel provides a very good and varied spread (including very decent espresso) and, to give a comparison, a croissant, coffee and orange juice at the nearby La Rotonde will easily set you back a similar amount. Our only gripe would be that prices that were reasonable in the summer seem to have gone up rapidly along with the rankings. But that is perhaps unavoidable...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fabolous”
Reviews.Author: anaditter
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for two nights at the Chaplain and our experience exceed our expactations. We stayed in the classic room. Everything very new and modern and above all, clean. Great staff (polite and youg, really fresh). The location was also perfect, near by a bike station, with lots of small and interesting stores to explore at its surroundings. We just cannot waint until the next time!!!! Thanks again to the Chaplain.

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel in the right place”
Reviews.Author: PedroRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: It is a charming hotel with comfortable and clean rooms, although a little small. The service is good and the location is excellent. Close to a subway station and with a lot of good restaurants nearby. I recomend to every one and I will stay there again when return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: keesjake
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Wonderful bakery around the corner and lots of restaurants and cafes. Close to public transportation and easy walking to everything. Staff was very friendly and their english was great since we don't speak French. Room was small, but that is what we heard about all rooms in Paris. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelSneak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the decor is very modern. The bathroom is very nice. The room is a little small by American room size standards but normal by European room size standards. However the furniture design is so efficient that you don't even notice the small room. I loved this place! The neighborhood could not be beat- we traveled all over Paris and always looked forward to coming back to our great 'hood. Be sure to eat at the fantastic Caribbean restaurant next door and the Villa Borghese around the corner. Metro is a block away as well as a taxi stand. I would stay here agian and would highly recommend it to a friend. It is a very safe and clean neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel. I just wish it were in a more convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: DrHickenlocher
Reviews.Content: Chaplain Rive Gauche as a hotel was delightful, with cute style (although IKEA furniture), great service from the staff, and a very reasonable price. I only wish it were in a slightly better spot. My wife and I spent 4 nights here, using it as our base of operations with which to explore Paris for the very first time. We arrived from Charles de Gaulle and took the Air France Bus to Gare Montparnasse. From there, it was about a 1.0km walk (10 minutes-ish) to the hotel. No problem for our two roller suitcases and a backpack. Definitely print yourself a map, though. The hotel is tucked away into a quiet little side street (great for lack of noise). We were ably greeted and all the staff spoke enough English to help us out. We were then told we'd been upgraded to a Club room from a Classic for our stay, and got Room #5 on the Ground Floor right behind the lobby. This turned out to be just fine for us (very convenient, no elevators or stairs), but if you are a really light sleeper or want a view, you might want to ask for a different room. They have 5 floors to work with. It wasn't that we could hear anything in the lobby, but apparently the stairs were right next to the room, so we could hear people going up and down at night and in the morning. And the only window was out of the way and only faced the courtyard. Again, we didn't mind, so we just stayed put. Room was typically Parisien-small, even if it was a "Club". We had enough room to put our suitcases next to the bed on the far side, and walk around the near side plus a little wing chair, along with a small desk and the IKEA closet. The bed was comfortable enough. And the room had everything we "needed", like phone, hair dryer, wall safe, and microfridge. THE GOOD: * Free use of a laptop with Internet access in the lobby, along with water and tea, even in the middle of the night. Just beware the funky French keyboard. * Free Wi-Fi if you do bring your own computer (we didn't). * Free local calls. We got a calling card, and rather than having to go to a pay phone, we could call from our room without any additional charges, unlike say... the Hilton. * Literally a hop away from Vavin metro. And the patisserie just before you get to the Metro is really good. THE BAD: * Vavin isn't a really good Metro stop. It only has Line 4. And transferring to any line but Line 12 at Montparnasse-Bienvenue is a LONG hike underground in the tunnels. We transferred to Line 6 (Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, etc.) by going BACKWARDS at Raspail to get the short transfer instead of hiking at Montparnasse. Montparnasse-Bienvenue, Edgar Quinet, and Notre-Dame-des-Champs aren't that far away. But after a day of hiking around museums and monuments, we'd rather just catch a transfer to get to Vavin... eventually. * The glass door in the shower/tub only goes back like 2 feet, and there's no curtain. So LOTS of water splashed out onto the floor, completely drenching the little floor towel. Also, the diverter spout got stuck a few times. My wife absolutely could not switch it from "bathtub" flow to "shower" flow without me. * The electrical outlets are recessed, meaning one of our converters wouldn't fit into it. We found this was the same in Germany as well, although not in Italy. Just something to be aware of. GOOD TO KNOW: * The key is this heavy silver cone keychain with a physical key attached to it. You have to use the key to lock/unlock the door, from outside AND when inside. Just hope there isn't a fire inside where you need to leave, only to find you need the key to get yourself OUT. Highly unlikely, but something to be aware of. * You have to leave the key at the front desk whenever you leave. Not a big deal, no worries about losing it.
