But for the first couple of days, we would return home to find a never-met-before staff member and just say "Room #5", and they would hand us the key. By the second or third day, they recognized us and pulled out #5 as we arrived, but for those first couple of days, I wonder what would have happened if just ANYONE waltzed in and asked for "#5". Would the staff have given the key to them? * I think the A/C is disabled unless you ask them to turn it on. The temperature in the room was always nice, so we never bothered. * Breakfast is optional, but expensive. Better to go out. All in all, Chaplain Rive Gauche provided exactly what we'd expected: clean, safe, comfortable accommodations to sleep in and get ready for the next day in. It's not a resort with bells and whistles, but the free internet access was really nice and the staff were always so polite and helpful (especially the guy who gave us the 5am wake-up call for our flight out!). I would totally recommend the hotel itself to anyone else. But personally, if I was to go to Paris again, I might try to find a place closer to a better Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: djinc01
Reviews.Content: We chose Le Chaplain Rive Gauche based on location and some decent reviews for our first trip to Paris. It met all expectations (and exceeded a few... we were worried about the lack of a/c and size of european rooms, but our room was great--and featured frigid a/c and plenty of room). My French is okay, but the staff all spoke good English, were exceptionally kind and spent quite some time with me, helping me call restaurants for reservations (since so many were closed in August). The view was nothing great from our room, but the neighborhood was nice. Although many of the local shops, pubs, and restaurants were closed... one place nearby that was open, had great food and atmosphere and we will now always hold dear is La Rotonde (where we got engaged!).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, quiet area...”
Reviews.Author: EilIrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really stylish & modern with a good location next to the metro station at Vavin. The area around the hotel was really quiet at night so if you're looking for a lively cafe atmosphere I would stay somewhere else. The rooms are small with a good bathroom. Don't stay in the rooms across form the courtyard as there is only one tiny window, we were put here first but requested a move. The stairs are steep up to the other rooms and the lift is tiny - just so you're aware. We had breakfast in Le Rotonda just up from the hotel and it was nice - breads, juice, coffee (yum). I would suggest spending a little time in the Luxemborg Gardens at the end of rue Vavin and visiting the chocolate shop - also on the street, but apart from these two things you will need to take the metro to everywhere else, which is no problem. Overall a lovely hotel in a poor-ish location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay - cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slidegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a coworker. I enjoyed my stay, and had no problems with the booking or the visit. The room was available early, and was spotless and quiet. Free internet in the hotel. Skipped breakfast, which looked expensive but nice. Very courteous, English speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel exactly met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: mayya88
Reviews.Content: I 've been in Paris several times and stayed in both easy and more expensive hotels. I checked lots of hotels before booking Chaplan this time. After my stay I agree that all comments on web is true: nice location, very friendly staff, cosy fashionable rooms, clean. Did not have a chance to have breakfast - can not comment - but true that so many nice places to go out for meals just close to hotel... And Thai place next doors is very good. Agree that rooms are pretty small, I upgraded my room from single to club to feel more comfortable. But for me size of room was not most important thing staying in Paris! I think it is one of really good choices .

Reviews.Title: “lovely room great hotel”
Reviews.Author: newbies_7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Our room and shower-room were really nice. On our last day we left our luggage after checking out and, on return, we were able to use a really nice room to freshen up before our flight. The only slight criticism is that the coffee in reception should be free to residents - we are used to having facilities in the room. Brilliant location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice - not your typical Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelguy
Reviews.Content: I've visited Paris many times and like many of you, I've been disappointed with the accomodations in Paris - typically over-priced, tiny and not well-kept. HOTEL LE CHAPLAIN was much different. A nice boutique hotel, stylish, clean and a bit larger than most comparable Paris hotels. Even the bed was comfy and the bathroom was spacious! The only drawback of this hotel is it's location. While it is just across the road from Vavin Metro station, you'll be forced to use Metro & taxis to get around. It's a sleepy neighborhood with little to see and quite far (and boring) on foot to the more interesting areas of town. But all around, a great choice. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeweYarakDavid
Reviews.Content: very quiet, very kleen, very helpful staff, good location, excellent value for money. free wifi good place to stay in Paris i

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quiet and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: D_E1328
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the second leg of our 5 day stay in Paris. It was an amazing hotel. We were looking for a nice hotel that was quickly accessible to le Metro and eateries. Both of these requirements were met and more. The hotel is tucked away on a very quiet side street just off of the main Blvd Raspail and the Vavin Metro Station on the M4. The lobby is quaint, but fantastically designed. Very art deco. The staff spoke proficient english and were quite accomodating the entire stay. We lucked out and had a room on the 5th floor. Using the lift we got to the 5th floor which had only 4 or 5 rooms. Every now and then you'd hear another door or person, but very rarely. The rooms were small. Perhaps the only drawback, but storage is great if you use the built-in cabinents in the headboard. We had the room with the Mona Lisa's smile head board...cool touch. The entire room was very clean and that goes for the bathroom. Personally thought the bathroom was bigger than most, so it was a nice luxury to have. At the time the a/c was not on, but it appeared to be available. We just opened the windows and had a great view of Paris life. One of the more unique things about this hotel and I'm sure many others was the use of actual keys. Each time you left they requested that you leave the key at the front desk. At first it was slightly unusual, but after time it was nice to not worry about losing it. There was a great bakery down the way along with a host of restaraunts near by. The hotel also had free wi-fi if needed. All in all, this is a fantastic hotel that we would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: petradietrich
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Chaplain is directly connected to the Northern and Eastern train stations by the Métro line 4. The hotel is very comfortable and stylish at the same time. The staff is very friendly and helpful if you need help and the breakfast is recommendable because much better than the usual idealess breakfasts in France. Wifi on the rooms is free and computer can be used in the public area without charges. You will not hear your neighbour snoor because of thin walls to your neighbour's room. I am often in Paris, tried a lot of hotels and find the Chaplain the best option concerning price/performance ratio.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable space in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pjsagona
Reviews.Content: This was our first family visit to Paris. The Hotel Chaplain was a very nice experience. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The Hotel is very good with English speaking guests. The breakfast was fantasic. The rooms while small, were very comfortable. The air conditioning worked very well -- the temperature in Paris during out visit approached (32C) ~90F. Hotel Chaplain is in an excellent location, about 1-block from the Vavin Metro -- easy access to all of Paris. There are a wide variety of shops and restaurants within walking distance to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large room upscale location”
Reviews.Author: bmrp
Reviews.Content: The bed was VERY hard. I know European beds are generally hard but I couldn't sleep it as so hard. My husband who normally likes hard beds thought it was a bit hard. We had a superior room with the mini bar included. However they only put one coke, orange juice,and water in the bar. In other words, it isn't like the normal US minibars. The shower has great water pressure (with the typical half door on the shower) hair dryer, safe, tv and nice decor. The area has great stores for upscale shopping. If it weren't for the bed I'd stay again but I need my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Golfer_Girlie
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights there and loved this hotel. Location is central to all the sites and metro stop is very close. Everything is walkable. Good restaurants/cafes close by. Rooms are small but well organized. Has hair dryer and magnifying mirror. Beds are comfortable and staff are very accomodating. Mini bar is free - very nice bonus. Elevator is small but I didn't mind taking the stairs. Only letdown was shower - has door but not well sealed so bathroom gets wet. Staff gives extra towels so not really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MerBear480
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean, but SMALL!!! Wireless internet is free - you get your password at the desk. No shower curtain in the shower, so it gets wet fast. No iron here, but they do give you a blowdryer. Room by the elevator constantly hears knocking sounds. The "elevator" itself only holds four people without luggage. Also, we found our door unlocked one day coming back from sightseeing - NOT GOOD IN A BIG CITY. Hotel is cute and fun, but not really worth it. Plasma in the room is good. Being able to open your windows a plus, until we figured out that the hotel has AC but doesn't turn it on - you have to figure that out yourself. Mini fridge is barren of alcohol in PARIS! Definitely confusing. All in all, nice place to put your head, clean and cute - but don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: alyak
Reviews.Content: Everything OK but room was too dark (one small window to the tiny patio)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fidelio1712
Reviews.Content: 100m away from the next metro-station (Vavin, Metro 4), friendly staff, clean rooms, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Asatis
Reviews.Content: In general, our stay at the Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche was very good. The location of the hotel was perfect; near Montparnasse Avenue where there are many shops and cafes. Moreover, it's only about 3-5 mins walk to Vavin metro station. We coundn't be happier about that. The check in was fast and efficient. The room is not big, but again, that's something you should expect when it comes to staying in Europe. I actually think the room kind of look like the pictures on the hotel's website. We liked the bathroom a lot, espeacially the bath products. The service was decent, better than I expected. Because my stay was for 4 nights, I ran into 4-5 front desk staff. Most of them were very helpful and friendly. There was probably only one that I felt was not as good as the others. During my stay, the only problem I had was the broken AC. Since our stay included friday and saturday night, the noise outside was pretty loud so it was hard for us to sleep with the windows open. Again, we couldn't close the windows because the AC wasn't working. It'll be too hot and too hard to breath. We let the front desk know but the probblem wasn't fixed. We would've given this hotel a 5 on a scale of 1 to 5 and 5 being excellent if the the whole AC wasn't a problem. However, I would definitely recommend this hotel for its value. Eventually, the AC will get fixed, and the quality of a stay will be better!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - modern, clean in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HeidiToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four day weekend in beautiful Paris. This was our first stay at the Chaplain, and we have absolutely no complaints. The rooms are small, but tastefully decorated in a modern style. The bathrooms are updated and lovely. The front desk couldn't have been more accommodating -- they had a room ready for us at 10 am on arrival day, and were happy to help out with everything from restaurant reservations to the printout of our boarding passes (after the online check-in) on departure day. The location is brilliant - steps away from the Luxembourg garden as well as countless cafes, restaurants and the metro. Given the high price point of most hotels in Paris, this is one of the best deals out there. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location good, service not”
Reviews.Author: Eagleton
Reviews.Content: Good location - near to various Metro stations and in a nice part of Paris. The rooms too are quite well furnished and comfortable with modern decore and new bathrooms (well at least mine was). If that was the full story everything would be great because for Paris (which I find to generally be very expensive) it was reasonable value too....but that is not all. Dont waste your money on the breakfast which is overpriced and not very good. There are many nice and better value cafes just outside the front door. Also, the service was very poor. The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night by mistake and despite having to evacuate the building no apology or mention was made for the annoying inconvenience. Further, no offer was made to call a cab on departure. Also on departure, the staff member was happy to 'discuss' with me in front of other patrons the, 'apparently accidental' attempt to charge me twice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the hustle and bustle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: andrew43hill
Reviews.Content: My partner had not been to Europe before and was amazed at Paris and relaxed by this quiet, pleasant hotel near to St Germain de Pres....perfect for the couple in love in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Hotel Room In Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Chaplain on our recent tour of France. The room was impecably clean and fresh. It's a tiny room but so are all of the others where we stayed in France. I'm sure you could pay more - - much more - - somewhere in Paris to get a larger room, but this one was sufficient for our purposes. We didn't try their breakfast since there were several places nearby to get fresh croissants and cafe, i. e., coffee. They have a lift, as they call it, which is necessary due to the narrow winding stairs. There's a movie theater next door if you can understand the French language. We can't but made ado at the Hotel Chaplain. Asta is a charm from Bordeaux and speaks perfect English. Some of the others do not. The Metro stop is Vavin and is just around the corner from this hotel. That's a plus. You should try the Timbre Restaurant which is a two minute walk from this hotel. It's gourmet French food at an affordable price, considering that room and board is rather high in France with the value of the dollar being what it is. They give you sodas, water, and juice daily for free, but the little refrigerator could have been somewhat colder. The bed was very comfortable. I saw a few businessmen there as well. All in all, it's a very fine hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: fieldinggray
Reviews.Content: Nice room in a great neighbourhood. The service was very good and the reception area both beautiful and welcoming, with the complimentary tea in beautiful cups adding that extra touch. The bathroom was beautiful, although a shower curtain would have been nice to prevent the whole floor of the bathroom getting wet while showering. The free minibar in the room (with water, orange juice and soft drinks) was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stylish hotel between Jardin du Luxembourg and Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: natalieluc
Reviews.Content: Hello, we recently spent short weekend in this hotel. The staff were very friendly, with nice acceuil. Rooms are very tastefully decorated, relatively spacious, with excellent new bath and shower facilities (a real pleasure). Lots of small details (small present in the rooms, coffee machine in the reception, free minibar, access to internet). Spotlessly clean. The location is perfect -- only 3' walk to Jardin du Luxembourg and 1m' walk to cafes of Monparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “location couldnt be better, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mrnit
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights in this hotel and highly recommend to those who want to stay in central paris. location couldnt have been better, quite street but a minutes walk from great cafe's,fab resturants, luxembourg park, and metro. After nearly walking the city we think the location couldnt have been better. rooms were not big but were spotless and modern, great showers by the way.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterSanJose
Reviews.Content: I stayed last February in the hotel Chaplain and I had a great time. You received a first class service and the rooms are cozy. If you are looking a hotel in the center of Paris this is it!

Reviews.Title: “everything great, but the room.”
Reviews.Author: hammerpants
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel and lovely staff. The room I stayed in wasn't nice, it's right next to reception and because the walls are thin, you can hear people going up and down the stairs all night. If you decide to stay here, don't take the 'classic' option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the excellent location. Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Olia_Rotterdam
Reviews.Content: This was our second hotel during our stay in paris. Before that we stayed in the 3* hotel near Etoile-Arc du Triumph and without any doubt we liked Hotel Chaplain much more than the first one both as regards the hotel itself and the location. We stayed for two nights in March. Everything was very good, rooms a bit small but this applies to all Parisian hotel, staff was very friendly and english speaking, extremelly helpfull and pleasant. On top of all of this, I enjoyed some nice little extras which made the stay really exceptional - they offer a minibar with drinks (non-alcohol) and wifi in the room for free. Not to mention that it is located just in two min walking from Vavin metro station which offers the direction to Gare du Nord (for those traveling with Thalys or Eurostar this is of a big value). Plenty places to have an exquisite Parisian breakfast in the local boulangerie, great sea-food in the nearby Bar-des-Huitres (read oisters:)))) I would definitelly recommend this hotel to everybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hôtel, excellent staff and sevice”
Reviews.Author: hindb13
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Chaplain Rive Gauche Hotel in January with my family. It's really a very good hotel, where you can enjoy your trip. Rooms are nice and comfortable. Staff and service are excellent. I'll come back with pleasure in this hotel and will recommand it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A good, basic hotel in a reasonable location - but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: agrippina17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid-February. Everything was fine - we had no problems and no complaints - but I've only given 3 stars because I'm not sure that the hotel is as special as some of the reviews and the high Trip Advisor rating suggests. The 'classic' room we stayed in was spotlessly clean but very small. Wardrobe space is extremely limited and we could only just squeeze our suitcase down beside the bed and the wall. There was a small flat-screen tv on the wall in one corner of our room, showing French channels. The bedding felt quite cheap and scratchy but the bed was reasonably comfortable. The bathroom was small (no bath) but the power shower was really great; easily the best thing about the room. There was an electronic safe, a hairdryer and a small fridge (containing water and soft drinks) in the wardrobe. The hotel is about a minute's walk from Vavin metro station, which is about 20 minutes from Gare du Nord on the No 4 metro line (it looks much longer on the metro map, but it was surprisingly quick). It's very easy to get into the centre of town either on foot (about 30 minutes' walk) or via the metro. There are also lots of bars, restaurants and take-aways in the streets around the hotel. We paid €119 per night for the room and I think that was about right. It's a good, basic hotel in a reasonable location - but nothing about the hotel really stands out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pjc16wg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights after looking at reviews on a number of travel sites, TripAdvisor included. We were not disappointed. The hotel's decor is clean, modern and slick. The room was a good size and well presented. Standards of cleanliness were excellent. Staff were helpful and pleasant. The hotel breakfast, although not cheap, was good quality. The hotel is in a good location: a minute's walk from Vavin metro station, with others no more than 5 minutes away. Port Royal RER station is only 10 minutes walk. The hotel is close to the Boulevard Montparnasse with brasseries and cafes to suit all tastes and budgets. However it's on a side street which did not seem to us to be particularly busy or noisy. This was a great place to stay - we thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jolly212
Reviews.Content: A big "Merci beaucoup" to all Hotel staff for being so helpfull and nice. The hotel is really near by Monparnsse and so quite. The rooms are very modern with sweet decoration. Thank you for all. I will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful but beware the noise”
Reviews.Author: Messrs.deBS
Reviews.Content: Really nice, well located hotel. Clean and well equipped rooms with great contemporary decor. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Although sited off the main road, the hotel is next to 2 restaurants and a very lively Irish bar. We were staying at the hotel over a weekend and because of the smoking laws, people from the restaurants and bars were smoking outside and were very noisy, even with double glazing and being on the second floor, we were kept awake until 5 a.m. on Saturday morning and only faired a little better on Saturday night/Sunday morning. It was a shame, if we went back we would enquire about the possibility of a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: TonZyl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a nicely quiet street, only steps away from the metro (Vavin), and within easy walking distance of Montparnasse restaurants and pubs. The room (nr. 52) was as small as you may expect in Paris, but in excellent condition. All furniture was new, and the bathroom was of modern design and of fine quality. Everything was very clean. We paid 119E per night for a double room, which was excellent value for money, given what we booked in the same price category and time of year before in Paris. Staff were very much service oriented and friendly throughout our stay. Wifi service was very good and free (ask for login code at reception), which to me is a primary booking criterium nowadays. Hotel breakfast was good but for 14E per day per person we opted to buy breakfast around the corner at a local bakery/patisserie.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Traveller092
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, well placed for local eating places and for the Metro - it is about a minute from the Vavin Metro station. As mentioned by others the rooms are fairly small, but attractively decorated and well thought out. Would definitely stay here again. Tip: Try Le Relais de l’Entrecôte, just around the corner past the Vavin Metro, for excellent Steak/Frites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Montparnasse Hotel”
Reviews.Author: professor51
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel in the 14th, just around the corner trom the Vavin metro stop. Easy access to and from CDG on the RER. You couldn't ask for better. The room I stayed in was small but extremely well furnished so you could work, rest, or have something to drink from the minibar. The breakfast is nice and basic, pastries fresh, coffee stong and abudant. I have been here twice and its been consistently great. The staff is friendly, helpful, and they speak English and tolerate my bad French. Its a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cosy, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabriso
Reviews.Content: Thanks for tripadvisor, we'd chosen the correct hotel to stay during our little honeymoon trip. This hotel was what we wanted: great location near tube, shops and restaraunts; clean and really boutique room with a window in bathroom (!!), friendly staff, french buns for breakfast. Everything is perfect here. We are definitely looking forward coming back because we loved Paris so much and Chaplain is the part of it..

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mimi0054
Reviews.Content: I had a romantic getaway in Paris with my boyfriend and we stayed in this hotel for a few nights. We had a great time. The hotel is really beautifully decorated. Great taste and attention to detail (I absolutely loved the painting in the bedroom). Lovely atmosphere and very nice staff. The location of the hotel is perfect. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: camedeiros
Reviews.Content: I loved this little hotel in Paris. It is located in a quiet street, close to Les Galeries Lafayette. There are only 28 rooms. They are small but very clean, with contemporary decoration. The bed was excellent and the bathroom and shower were very good too. The people at the reception were also very helpful and polite. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: MoMosMaMa
Reviews.Content: I took my friend to Paris for her 40th birthday and we stayed at Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche. Our room was clean and the beds extremely comfortable for European standards. The minibar offered a large bottle of Evian, cans of coke, coke light and juice each day, and it was free. The staff understood and spoke English very well. Continental breakfast was provided in the morning offering tea, coffee, juice, selection of pastries, croissants and hard-boiled eggs. A very nice, relaxing and fun stay!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Chaplain Rive Gauche
HotelInfo.Address: 11 bis, rue Jules-Chaplain | 06 Arr., 75006 Paris, France
